task: Let $A \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}$ be matrix for which $A^\top = - A$ (\textit{antisymmetric}). Show that the diagonal entries are zero, i.e.,  $a_{ii} = 0$ for all $1\leq i\leq n$.
solution:
From $A^\top = - A$ it follows that 
$$a_{ii} = - a_{ii} $$
for all $1 \leq i \leq n$. This equation is only true for the number $0$.
